R Line - Weekend Planned Service Change
6:30 AM to 12 midnight, Sat and Sun, Jan 30 - 31 71 Av-bound R trains run express from Queens Plaza to 71 Av.
Q Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

11:30 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Jan 29 - Feb 1 No Q trains between 57 St-7 Av and Kings Hwy. Q service operates between Stillwell Av and Kings Hwy. Free shuttle buses operate as follows: 1. Express (non-stop) between Kings Hwy and Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr. 2. Local between Kings Hwy and Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr, making all stops. To Manhattan, take the D, F, or N from Stillwell Av. To Coney Island, take the D, F, or N at 34 St-Herald Sq or the D/N at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr. Between Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and 57 St-7 Av, take the N or R.
N Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Change

All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
M Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

6 AM to 12 midnight, Sat and Sun, Jan 30 - 31 No M trains between Myrtle Av and Essex St. Take the J, L and/or free shuttle buses instead. M service operates between Metropolitan Av and Myrtle Av all weekend. Use the J for service between Myrtle Av and Hewes St. Free shuttle buses provide alternate service between Hewes St and Essex St, stopping at Marcy Av. Transfer between J and M trains at Myrtle Av. Transfer between J trains and free shuttle buses at Hewes St. For direct service to/from Manhattan, use the L via transfer at Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.
L Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Change

An Explanation For This Morning's (Thursday, January 28) Delays On the Harlem & New Haven Lines

The delays you experienced this morning were the result of two trains becoming disabled at two separate locations. A Harlem Line train became disabled in the vicinity of Mount Vernon West at approximately 7:30 AM. At roughly the same time a Connecticut Department of Transportation Shore Line East train became disabled at Stamford. The disabled trains blocked one of four tracks in both areas, greatly reducing our operating capacity and creating congestion between Woodlawn-- where the Harlem and New Haven Lines converge-- and Grand Central Terminal. Crews were able to clear the disabled trains quickly, but residual delays were incurred in both directions for the remainder of the morning rush hour. We regret any inconvenience you may have experienced as a result of these incidents.

An Explanation for This Morning's (Wednesday, January 27) Delays

To Our Customers: The delays of up to 15 minutes that you experienced this morning were due to a switch failure discovered at a key point in the Park Avenue Tunnel of Grand Central Terminal just before the morning rush. The switch failure -- in conjunction with another switch that was already out of service for scheduled renewal work -- limited our ability to get trains in or out of Grand Central. (Switches enable your train to be guided from one track to another.) Crews are currently working to complete repairs later this afternoon to minimize any departure delays for your trip home. We appreciate your patience and regret any inconvenience you may experience due to the slower travel times due to this condition.

The LIRR is experiencing scattered delays averaging 10 minutes on the Oyster Bay, Port Jefferson, Ronkonkoma, and Babylon branches, and west of Speonk on the Montauk Branch, due to ongoing effects of this weekend's blizzard. Service remains suspended on the Port Washington, Far Rockaway, Hempstead, Long Beach, & West Hempstead branches, & east of Speonk on the Montauk Branch. Service also remains suspended in both directions between Jamaica & Atlantic Terminal.

Metro-North is Operating Regular Weekday Service Today Monday, January 25

Metro-North is operating a regular weekday schedule Today Monday, January 25, 2016. While a regular schedule is in effect, there may be canceled and combined trains, and customers may experience delays and crowded conditions. For customers traveling southbound to Melrose and Tremont, trains will not stop at these stations. Please get off at Harlem-125th Street Station and take a local Harlem Line train north stopping at Melrose and Tremont stations. Customers wishing to travel southbound from Melrose or Tremont stations should use Fordham station or can take the Bx41 Bus from Fordham to Melrose. NYC Transit will cross-honor Metro-North tickets for the Bx41 during this service change. This service change will be in effect through Monday, January 25, due to third rail power issues as a result of the significant snow accumulations. For specific train times, customers should refer to the timetables, Metro-North Train Time or our interactive schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk .

Metro-North is Operating Regular Weekday Service Today Monday, January 25

Metro-North is operating a regular weekday schedule Today Monday, January 25, 2016. While a regular schedule is in effect, there may be canceled and combined trains, and customers may experience delays and crowded conditions. For customers traveling southbound to Melrose and Tremont, trains will not stop at these stations. Please get off at Harlem-125th Street Station and take a local Harlem Line train north stopping at Melrose and Tremont stations. Customers wishing to travel southbound from Melrose or Tremont stations should use Fordham station or can take the Bx41 Bus from Fordham to Melrose. NYC Transit will cross-honor Metro-North tickets for the Bx41 during this service change. This service change will be in effect through Monday, January 25, due to third rail power issues as a result of the significant snow accumulations. For specific train times, customers should refer to the timetables, Metro-North Train Time or our interactive schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk .
LIRR train service remains suspended until 7 AM on all branches due to the ongoing impact from this weekend's blizzard.

Governor Announces Restoration of Service on Most LIRR Branches for Monday's AM Rush

Governor Cuomo announced the restoration of service on most LIRR branches for AM Rush Mon. Jan 25. Regular weekday service to be provided on Babylon, Ronkonkoma, Pt Washington and Pt Jefferson branches as well as in LIRR diesel territory on the Oyster Bay & Pt Jefferson branches, between Greenport & Ronkonkoma, and Montauk Branch west of Speonk. Metro-North Will Operate Regular Weekday Service For Monday Morning, January 25

Metro-North will operate its regular weekday schedule on Monday morning, January 25, 2016. (For the remainder of today, Sunday, January 24, Metro-North will operate a Sunday schedule.) While a regular schedule is in effect for Monday, there may be canceled and combined trains, and customers may experience delays and crowded conditions. For customers traveling southbound to Melrose and Tremont, trains will not stop at these stations. Please get off at Harlem-125th Street Station and take a local Harlem Line train north stopping at Melrose and Tremont stations. Customers wishing to travel southbound from Melrose or Tremont stations should use Fordham station or can take the Bx41 Bus from Fordham to Melrose. NYC Transit will cross-honor Metro-North tickets for the Bx41 during this service change. LIRR train service has been suspended until further notice due to deteriorating weather conditions and concerns for customer and employee safety. Crews and snow fighting equipment have been dispatched and are working to help keep rails, switches and platforms clear of ice and snow. We advise customers to remain at home for the duration of this storm. After 4:00pm, train arrival data on the MTA web site and on third-party mobile apps may not reflect actual service availability.

Please take care when traveling during inclement weather and allow for additional time to get to your station. Customers should use caution when entering and exiting trains, and on platforms and staircases. Delays, cancellations and train combinations may occur depending upon the severity of the snow storm and its impact on our service territory. Customers should listen for station announcements. Be sure to continue to check www.mta.info and the media for updates. Also, see our Winter Weather Travel Guide at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html for travel tips

N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

Depending on weather conditions, weekday planned service changes are subject to change. NIGHTS 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Jan 25 - 29 No N trains between Times Sq-42 St and Queensboro Plaza - Take the 7 or Q instead. N service operates in two sections: 1. Between Stillwell Av and Times Sq-42 St. 2. Between Queensboro Plaza and Ditmars Blvd For service between Queens and Manhattan, take the 7. D Line - UPDATED Weeknight Planned Service Change

The following planned service change is ADDED: 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Jan 4 - 8 205 St-bound D trains are rerouted via the N from Stillwell Av to 36 St. To Bay 50 St, 25 Av, Bay Pkwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, 79 St, 71 St, 55 St, 50 St, Ft Hamilton Pkwy, and 9 Av, take the D to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound D. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound D to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or Stillwell Av and transfer to a 205 St-bound D. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: -Between stations within Connecticut -Between Connecticut and New York stations -Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December.
Metro-North's New Year's Day Holiday Service

Ring in the New Year with us! On New Year's Day (Friday, January 1, 2016), we will operate hourly service, with two additional mid-day trains to New Haven to accommodate higher demand between noon and 2 PM. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned until 12 noon New Year's Day. Get train times at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm
